title: KNuggies Education Platform
description: より多くの開発者を迅速に採用するためには、カルダノエコシステムにおけるガイドコースの利用可能性を改善する必要があります。

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal to develop guided courses for Cardano developers. If done well obviously a great resource. Once developed will the courses be free or paid? If paid, what is the cost?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has developed a beta version, though it cannot be accessed without a login (which I did not provide). It would be good to provide evidence that the proposer has the skills to successfully deliver this type of course. There is not detail on the structure of the courses or how successful completion of a course will be verified. Will there be exams for competency?
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal need smore detail on the structure of the courses that will be provided so that delivery and be audited vs the plan. It would be good to see some KPI's on number of dev's to come through the programs with goals set on these so that success can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal  highlighted a problem and proposed a solution however the shared link has a password and test credentials would have been provided .
The proposal is great with the exception of the above mentioned issue.
I agree
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal did not provide verifiable link of given experience .
The proposal has a clear implementation plan and timeline with cost breakdown.
considering the above I neither Agree nor Disagree.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided sufficient information to audit the progress and success of the proposal, i agree.

f6_assessments.q0: Availability of trained programmers is a critical requirement in the Cardno ecosystem due to Haskel and a completely new language in the form of Plutus. The Plutus pioneer program(PPP) is playing a role, however, the availability of more than one set of courses will help the aspiring developers in the Cardano system.  I had completed PPP, and I still feel more courses addressing the same in different manner will help a lot.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has claimed that he is an educator and is creating training material on youtube. However, references of his past work were not found enclosed. The model for certification, type of courses, and focus group are not clearly defined.  With these inputs, it is hard to say with certainty that the proposer will be able to achieve the intended aim.
f6_assessments.q2: The cost breakdown is not clarified. The number of functional points for the site and the number of developers to be employed are also not clear. A sustainable model for the initiative also needs to clear and defied the audit process for the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The goal of this proposal it to fasten the onboarding process of new developers by providing guided courses to learn Haskell, Plutus etc.  on a newly created app/platform. 
As there are already many educational initiatives around Catalyst which are already executing I would have like to hear from to proposer how his approach is different and how this will put additional value tonto the our ecosystem. So, the overall impact of this project remains unclear. But it is submitted under the right challenge as the goal is to improve the developer ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan is roughly described. Unfortunately, too little is known about the didactic quality of the courses. It would be good to directly present an example to better assess the ability of the proposer.
Not even the own Youtube channel is linked, which I found by chance myself. So at least we have a proof-of-life. The description of the budget is incomplete. It mentions front-end and back-end development, but not creating the courses? What is the marketing budget spent on? What strategy will be used to attract developers to the platform? Is it free of charge? More information is needed for a better evaluation.
f6_assessments.q2: The timeline is roughly described and the result is relatively clearly formulated. However, we have no clue how to measure the success of the proposal?  How many developers should be trained?this would be important to decide on responsible use of the treasury. Also it would be good to have a more detailed curriculum of the courses to be able to monitor the progress of the project. The idea is basically valuable, for a better evaluation the above mentioned points should be integrated.

f6_assessments.q0: An educational website/apps are absolutely in the correct challenge. Any developer eco-system can use more educational content.
f6_assessments.q1:
I do not believe in the presented plan and the implementation of the proposal. Here's why:
TBH I don't see the point in creating a site and applications if the creator can just use another platform like youtube, as he mentioned he is doing. The only point I see in creating a custom site/apps for education is for them to be interactive, and there was nothing of the sort mentioned anywhere in the proposal. Another thing I find strange is that you can not log in or register the site pointed in the proposal (https://www.knuggies.com), which is kind of strange to be perfectly honest. The proposer says: "The beta app is currently live at …", but it's actually not or at least appears to be only a login/register form. Another thing I find curious is the fact the only Jason Barhorst who is an Electrical Engineer https://www.linkedin.com/in/jason-barhorst/ doesn't appear to have any Haskel or Plutus experience to teach it, but I can agree that he can hire people to do that for him, although he claims to be an educator in the proposal. I've tried PM-ing the proposer to clear some questions I have but unfortunately, I've gotten no response.
If the proposer is serious, I would recommend taking a step back and think about what a good business plan looks like and then come and try again in fund 7. To point him in the right direction: https://venngage.com/blog/business-proposal/, I believe these are good guidelines that can be applied for the next crypto proposal round.
f6_assessments.q2: I don't believe the information provided in the proposal is sufficient so the community can track the costs. There were no concrete hosting providers, hourly rates, marketing platforms to be used, or timetable breaking down all expenses given so I couldn't check any of the amounts requested for the proposal. The only metric that can be tracked is the full public launch date (April 1st, 2022), which IMO is nearly not enough.

solution: KNuggiesは、HaskellやPlutusなどを学ぶためのガイド付きコースを、オンチェーンの証明書を使って提供する教育サイト・アプリです。
experience: 電気技師、プログラムマネージャー、教育者としての経験を持つ。現在、YouTubeで無料講座を展開し、その内容をアプリに移植中。
